FAQ

What is InFuture?

InFuture is the largest high school hackathon in the Greater New York City area. Focused on inspiring today's generation, the event will bring together high school students to connect, collaborate, and learn.

Why are we doing this?

We want high school students to have a way to express their ideas in a professional environment, as college students and adults often have. We believe they all can innovate the future.

When and where?

InFuture will take place in the Greater New York City area in August of 2015.

Who can apply?

Any student, up to and including the high school graduating class, is welcome to apply! Anyone in college and beyond is welcome to apply as a mentor. If you're unsure if you are eligible, shoot us an email at info@infuture.io

What should I bring? How much does this cost?

You should bring your laptop and charger, school ID, phone and charger, and power strips (recommended). Food will be provided! This event costs absolutely nothing!

Do I need a team?

Single person teams are allowed, but we encourage you to work in group! Teams can have up to four people spanning any schools.

Will there be food?

All meals, snacks, and drinks will be provided for the entire weekend. If you have a dietary restriction, please make sure to mention it in the application. There will be a wide variety of food.

Can I temporarily leave the event?

Unfortunately due to liability issues, you may not temporarily leave the event unless given consent by an organizer.

Are there hardware or prizes?

More information will be released soon.

Will there be travel reimbursement?

More information will be released soon.

Interested in sponsoring or mentoring?

We'd love to have you join us at the event! Please contact us at info@infuture.io

.

I have more questions, where do I ask?

We would love to hear from you! Please email us at info@infuture.io
